title: "What is the role of women in esoteric traditions and mystical practices?"
first_phrase: This text discusses the exclusion of women from initiation into the mysteries of ancient spiritual orders such as Mithraism and Buddhism. It provides insights into the reasons for this exclusion, such as the requirement of absolute transcendence, which is not considered an ideal for women. The text explains that women are instead encouraged to develop within systems of “participation” rather than attempting to pursue absolute principles. The author mentions that women played a passive role in certain male-dominated religious cults, acting as mediums or priestesses rather than initiates. The latter part of the text explores the relationship between masculine virility and solar principles across various traditions.

last_phrase: In conclusion, it is important to clarify that the presence of women in typically male cults should not be misinterpreted, as in many cases, they had a passive role as a medium for higher forces. Additionally, the relationship between the masculine force and the solar principle is recognized in various traditions. While women in yoga do engage in sexual magic, the type of yoga and goals pursued must be taken into consideration.
